CatDescriptText: Mrs. Erma Johnson, Terrace Village, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 15, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "In dispensing political patronage jobs to various groups, what should bet eh determining factor- the financial contribution of that group to the party, or the number of votes the group casts for the party?" answer reads: "The number of votes because it shows how many people are backing the party."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Erma Johnson wearing earrings and dark double breasted coat, standing on sidewalk in front of building
